title: Youth Ninja Warrior Coach at The Grit Ninja (Fairfield County, CT)
description:
**The Grit Ninja Overview**

The Grit Ninja is a dynamic new company bringing a sense of fun and adventure to the fitness world through innovative  
"ninja warrior" based fitness for kids!

In our indoor facility in Norwalk, we run kids classes, birthday parties, and other types of special events.

In our outdoor “Grit on the Go” (GOTG) classes in Fairfield County, we bring our obstacles and transform open field space into ninja warrior obstacle courses. During each action-packed class, aspiring ninjas will climb, swing, jump and run on our ever-changing equipment, which includes a rock wall traverse, monkey bars, grip gauntlet, cliffhanger, balance courses, warped walls, and so much more! Our coaches will guide our ninjas as they tackle challenges that build strength, coordination, agility, balance, problem-solving skills, self-confidence and, most importantly, GRIT!

**Position Description**

● Assistant Coaches to help run indoor and outdoor weekday after school classes in various places throughout Fairfield County

● Assistant Coaches to help run indoor and outdoor weekend birthday parties and special events in various places throughout Fairfield County

● Kids are typically ages 5-12.

● The ideal candidate will be fun, energetic, motivated ,loves to be with children, has a positive attitude, is willing to work a flexible schedule, comfortable with assembling and carrying heavy equipment.

● We will provide the “Ninja Warrior” training.

**Our Mission**

At The Grit Ninja, we want to have a positive impact on people’s lives. We are coaching our ninjas to not only find the strength in their bodies, but to also find the strength in their minds. Our belief is that having grit is one of the key characteristics to success, both on the course and in everyday life and we want our coaches to help ninjas of all ages unlock the grit, tenacity, resilience, courage and resolve that we know is inside of them. Our program usually draws a pretty even split between boys and girls, and we take particular pride that a number of kids who don’t feel they have a home within traditional team sports have a home at The Grit Ninja.

**www.thegritninja.com**

**Please copy and paste this link to watch a video and get a better understanding of the duties and responsibilities of a Grit on the Go coach. It'll also allow you to see what type of coaches we are looking for.** https://youtu.be/3F7eNWVgNb4

Work Remotely

* No

Job Types: Part-time, Contract, Temporary

Pay: $16.00 - $25.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Referral program

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Application Question(s):

* Please let us know why you are interested in working at The Grit Ninja and experience you have working with kids
* Our Grit on the Go program takes place in various towns within Fairfield County. Are you willing to commute to different site locations?
* What days of the week are you available in the Fall of 2024? Are you available on weekends, if needed?

title: Operations Supervisor
description:
**Comunilife, Inc** is looking for experienced **Operations Shift Supervisors for its Bronx, Casa EL Faro** program. The Operations Shift Supervisor is responsible for managing Resident Assistants and the tour operations during the shift . Each tour will have a operations supervisor, reporting to the Program Director, who will monitor the overall program performance. The Operations Supervisor will oversee food service, housekeeping, room and common areas and interface with Security and hotel staff. Reporting to the Program Director, the Operations supervisor will be be ‘the front line’ with the Resident Assistants, in supporting clients in the program environment.

**Schedule:**

**Sun.-Tues. 12 am - 8 am and Fri.-Sat. 8am-4pm; Off days Wed. and Thurs.**

**Essential Duties:**

* The Operations Supervisor is responsible for ensuring a safe and healthy environment for all clients. To accomplish this, you will work with a team to oversee food service, security, maintenance and client support
* This position is responsible for the direct supervision of a team of Resident Assistants who are the front line in interacting with clients; providing them with access to their units, food and meal service and coordination with other program staff.
* Assuring a safe environment is a key role. This is accomplished by working closely with the security team---contracted by Comunilife, who provide front door and floor security. The Operations Supervisor will liaison with security staff, identify any issues, follow-up as needed and report to the Program Director on any security issues that arise.
* The program is located in a hotel, and the hotel staff is responsible for maintenance and housekeeping. The Operations supervisor will work with the hotel staff to ensure facility and room cleanliness—conduct routine inspections of rooms and common areas – direct the Resident Assistants and housekeepers to follow-up—and report to the Program Director on issues that arise.
* Conduct regular inspections of rooms to identify any maintenance issues and coordinate with the hotel staff on repairs. Resident assistants will submit work tickets for repair, and Operations Supervisor will monitor completion of work, and update reports accordingly.
* Work closely with the management team; Program Director and Assistant Program Director to ensure smooth program operations, report any issues as they arise, problem solve and communicate with all members of the team.
* Ensure food service operations are smooth, and that clients are provided with meals at designated times. Ensure that all procedures are followed, and that the Resident Assistants are monitoring food distribution and storage.
* As an Operations Supervisor you should be prepared for days that include a variety of tasks and interactions. As a supervisor, you'll always be focused on supporting, encouraging, and holding your team accountable and helping your team create a safe, positive, and inclusive work environment.
* You will model professionalism, embrace and champion change, and serve as an essential link for communication with and addressing needs of clients and the Resident Assistant team.
* Your tasks may include sitting at the reception desk checking clients in and out, answering the phone and routing calls, accepting donations from community members, helping to monitor client moves into/out of the shelter, doing room checks to ensure client well-being and safety, helping with meal delivery and special events, walking around the shelter to identify needs of clients and/or the facility, and generally supporting the needs of and relationships with clients, staff, and visitors throughout your shift.
* You will need to have skills to de-escalate a tough situation and to actively intervene when needed to ensure clients experiences are positive in the program.
* Responsible, organized, effective, and efficient. Ability to perform multiple assignments simultaneously.
* Skill to communicate effectively in writing, vocally, and to listen actively.
* Community minded, patient, creative, flexible, compassionate, and culturally sensitive to persons who are diagnosed with severe and persistent mental illness.
* Ability to deal tactfully and diplomatically with other Comunilife employees, Federal, State, and City officials, professional and technical groups, clients, and the general public.

**Schedule:**

* Tues.-Sat. 4pm-12pm
* Sun.-Thurs. 4pm-12pm
* Tues.-Sat. 12am-8am
* Sun.-Thurs. 12am-8am

**Job Qualifications**

**Experience and Education**

* Minimum of one years in a supervisory capacity preferred
* Minimum two years working with homeless or special needs population
* Demonstrated experience and success working with diverse individuals and special needs populations
* Trained in CPR & First Aid, Opiate Overdose Prevention, Fire Safety Systems (F80), crisis intervention, de-escalation preferred, Food Handlers certification
* Solid verbal and written skills
* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience preferred
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite

Comunilife is an EEO employer and provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Director, Engineering Operations
description:
Zelis is seeking to hire a Director, Engineering Operations who will play a pivotal role in aligning engineering operations with the company’s strategic business objectives. This role requires a visionary leader with a strong background in operational excellence, process integration, and strategic initiative execution.
The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of driving innovation, fostering continuous improvement, and managing budgets effectively. The new leader will report to the Chief Technology Officer (CTO), oversee a team of ~2, and may be based out of Boston MA, Morristown NJ, or St. Petersburg FL.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES* Oversee day-to-day operations of engineering teams, ensuring alignment with organizational goals.
* Develop and refine processes to optimize operational efficiency, focusing on scalability and agility.
* Integrate processes and technology to streamline operations and reduce redundancies.
* Monitor and report on KPIs related to engineering operations, identifying areas for improvement.
* Lead initiatives to optimize resource allocation and project prioritization.
* Ensure compliance with industry standards and best practices.
* Support the development and implementation of training programs to enhance staff skills and capabilities.
* Track, analyze, and report technology performance, identifying areas of risk and opportunity.
* Craft and deliver executive presentations, reports, and updates for senior executives.
* Summarize complex technical concepts for non-technical stakeholders and publish progress updates.
* Coordinate and lead planning sessions with the Price Optimization Tech SLT.
* Ensure relevant KPIs and strategic messaging for effective engagement with stakeholders.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders to drive collaboration and alignment.
* Foster a culture of continuous improvement and innovation within engineering teams, implementing best practices and new technologies to enhance operational efficiency.
* Align engineering operations with business strategies and objectives, ensuring technology initiatives support company growth and market position, in collaboration with the CTO.
* Define and execute key strategic initiatives, translating business goals into actionable plans, in collaboration with the CTO.
* Provide leadership in operational strategy sessions, ensuring alignment with the company's vision.
* Oversee the engineering department's budget, ensuring strategic resource allocation.


REQUIRED EXPERIENCE* Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Business or a related field.
* 10+ years of experience in engineering operations.
* 5+ years in a senior leadership role within technology teams, including those that support in-house shared services or product development, enterprise platforms like Salesforce, and infrastructure
* Proven track record of aligning engineering operations with business strategies.
* Strong background in process development, operational efficiency, and technology integration.
* Expertise in managing budgets and strategically allocating resources.
* Experience in fostering a culture of innovation and continuous improvement.
* Excellent leadership, visual presentation creation capabilities, communication skills.
* Ability to drive cross-functional collaboration and influence stakeholders.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Proficiency in project management and process optimization.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills.


PREFERRED EXPERIENCE* Master’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
* 5+ years of experience in change management and organizational transformation
* Experience in the healthcare technology industry.
* Strong project, program implementation, and management skills
* Experience building process and organization capability with scale, including recruiting, hiring, and optimizing a high-performing team.


As a leading payments company in healthcare, we guide, price, explain, and pay for care on behalf of insurers and their members. We’re Zelis in our pursuit to align the interests of payers, providers, and consumers to deliver a better financial experience and more affordable, transparent care for all. We partner with more than 700 payers, including the top-5 national health plans, BCBS insurers, regional health plans, TPAs and self-insured employers, over 4 million providers, and 100 million members, enabling the healthcare industry to pay for care, with care. Zelis brings adaptive technology, a deeply ingrained service culture, and a comprehensive navigation through adjudication and payment platform to manage the complete payment process.
Commitment to Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging  

At Zelis, we champion diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging in all aspects of our operations. We embrace the power of diversity and create an environment where people can bring their authentic and best selves to work. We know that a sense of belonging is key not only to your success at Zelis, but also to your ability to bring your best each day.
Equal Employment Opportunity  

Zelis is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
We encourage members of traditionally underrepresented communities to apply, even if you do not believe you 100% fit the qualifications of the position, including women, LGBTQIA people, people of color, and people with disabilities.
Accessibility Support
We are dedicated to ensuring our application process is accessible to all candidates. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran and require a reasonable accommodation with any part of the application and/or interview process, please email TalentAcquisition@zelis.com
SCAM ALERT: There is an active nationwide employment scam which is now using Zelis to garner personal information or financial scams. This site is secure, and any applications made here are with our legitimate partner. If you’re contacted by a Zelis Recruiter, please ensure whomever is contacting you truly represents Zelis Healthcare. We will never asked for the exchange of any money or credit card details during the recruitment process. Please be aware of any suspicious email activity from people who could be pretending to be recruiters or senior professionals at Zelis.
company_description: Zelis is a healthcare and financial technology growth company and market-leading provider of claims cost and payments optimization solutions to price, pay and explain healthcare claims.

title: Food Scientist
description:
**Job Summary**

Food Scientist will work with the Technical, Production and Sales teams to develop custom formulations while preforming effective formulation costing, developmental testing, trials, label claim and supp panel, new product specification establishment and regulatory compliance.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Report to Applications manager. In her/his absent report to VP of Quality and Applications.
* Work with Sales Team on current and new business opportunities to develop prototype products.
* Participate in technical customer calls to develop strategic business relationships. Provide technical consultation with the sales team to customers on new product ideation.
* Analyze cost saving initiatives obtained from alternative supplier qualification, processing formula changes, and analyzing inventory/logistics options.
* Re-costing and issuing quote sheet.
* Product development:
* Application Food Scientist II is responsible for entire product development process including but not limit to:
* Design formulations consistent with current market trends and customers visions.
* Raw material evaluation and qualifications.
* Develop and prepare samples for customers according to Sales needs.
* Perform cost calculation, ingredient sourcing coordination, application, sample preparation, sensory, quote sheet preparation, and label review.
* Attend meeting with sales or with customers and provide support on sales’ inquiry according to project qualifier.
* Conduct pre and post new product trial meeting to coordinate with departments for new product launch.
* Establish Safety Plan for new product.
* Sizing and choosing suitable packaging for new products.
* Support cost saving initiatives obtained from alternative supplier qualification, processing formula changes, and analyzing inventory/logistics options.
* Work with Production personnel to complete pilot run. Coordinate scale up and supervise first production runs. Coordinate new product launch including transferring formula to production department, determining ultimate processing condition, and refining formula during transition.
* Flavoring and sensory
* Technical support for the new product developed.
* Project management for the assigned projects.
* Assisting management to establish RFI prototype formula and marketing piece.
* Documentation
* Prepare Preproduction specification (PPS) according to project qualifier.
* Prepare and coordinate packaging qualifications and approval for new and existing products.
* Initiate and coordinate new ingredient qualification.
* Prepare and maintain single ingredient technical related documentation, both paper and electronic copy for all new products set up. Documents include but not limited to product specification, flow chart, nutritional, and other certificates.
* Use Genesis to create Nutritional certificate.
* Assisting in execution of product certifications (eg. Organic, Kosher, Gluten free, BE, NGP, Biodynamic etc.) as assigned, by maintaining and requesting supplier certificates and filling the certifiers paperwork and passing for review and submission.
* Fill product specific customer questionnaires as requested, for product handled.
* Completing product related Questionnaire (including TraceGains or customer specific portals) for customer, that involves communicating with suppliers for product knowledge and addition.
* Change Control evaluation
* Provide Technical support to internal and external customers.
* Application lab maintenance:
* Maintain projects bins organized and in appropriate order.
* Maintain the basic cleanness of countertop and scales. Attend a weekly application Lab cleaning meeting.
* Handle other special projects assigned by Application manager and VP of Quality and Applications.
* Work closely with Sales and qualify leads to generate new business and ensure that clients needs are met.
* Encourage potential clients to buy premium products and close the best possible deal.
* Build customer relationships with existing clients by reaching out via phone calls, emails or other formula of communication to increase the likelihood of them using our serves again

**Skills & Abilities**

* Excellent verbal and written communications skills.
* Excellent math, negotiation, and conflict resolution skills.
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Strong product knowledge, analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to prioritize tasks and multi-task, independently manage projects.
* Ability to work in a team environment and take direction from management and supervisors.
* Ability to read and interpret documents such as procedure manuals, work instructions, software manuals; ability to write routine reports and correspondence.
* Ability to work with and become proficient at Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), Basecamp, X3 Software and any other software tools acquired to perform this position’s duties.
* Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality.

**Education & Experience**

* Food Scientist requirements are minimum of BS/BA with 3-5 years industry experience.
* Well-rounded knowledge of Food and Dietary supplement and its applications.

**Physical Requirements**

* Various periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
* Reasonable periods of standing and performing Applications work in the Lab and / or Plant.

title: Early Childhood Education Consultant, Per Diem
description:
**Department:** Educational Services  

**Location:** New York, NY  


**Early Childhood Education Consultant, Per Diem/ Part-time**
-------------------------------------------------------------


**Department:**


**Educational Services**


**Location:**


**Connecticut and New York**


**Teaching Matters is a national nonprofit organization, headquartered in New York City, with the mission to close the opportunity gap of a radically unequal education system for underserved and historically marginalized children. From states and districts to schools and classrooms, we partner to help teachers and school leaders develop the skills they need to teach well, lead their peers and drive school-wide improvement.**


**Teaching Matters is expanding its innovative pre-school/ early childhood educational program throughout Fairfield County, Connecticut. The main scope of work will be to support early childhood education centers within community based organizations and public schools in Bridgeport and throughout Fairfield County. For candidates with additional K-2nd experience, there are options to work within Westchester and The Bronx, or to also work within ECE centers in The Bronx—these additional geographic areas are entirely optional and will not affect one’s hiring eligibility.**


**The scope of the work will include:**


* **Implement a program model focused on interactive read alouds, small group, and social-emotional learning supports to teachers, while engaging leaders in systemic change.**
* **Develop customized instructional coaching plans for teachers and leaders based on needs identified through a structured needs assessment process.**
* **Coach teachers within cycles of coaching focused on developing key competencies in teaching.**
* **Differentiate teacher support based on individual needs and address needed teacher mindset shifts.**
* **Facilitate teacher teams reflecting on practice, analyzing data that leads to deep analysis and identification of inequitable practices in schools, and looking at student work toward the goal of improving pedagogical practices and student outcomes.**
* **Guide leaders in making critical changes to systems, structures, and communication in their school, leading to an environment where professional collaboration is embraced and student success is the focus**
* **Build teachers/leaders understanding and proficiency in culturally responsive pedagogy and racial literacy.**
* **Build trusting relationships with partners that meets educators where they are and empowers them to continue to grow in their profession.**

**Key Qualifications:**


* **Minimum of 4 years experience in early childhood education as a teacher**
* **Strong content knowledge in early childhood development with a lens to culturally responsive curriculum and pedagogy.**
* **Demonstrated effectiveness in achieving ambitious, measurable student results.**
* **Experience facilitating teacher teams / groups to achieve student outcomes.**
* **Dynamic presenter, comfortable engaging large groups of educators in professional workshops and work-sessions.**
* **Experience teaching and/or coaching teachers in culturally responsive practices and curriculum development.**
* **Passion for advocating for students and communities traditionally marginalized and under-resourced.**
* **Experience in urban schools.**
* **Exemplar skills in technology and facile in utilizing zoom, google suite, and other online collaboration tools.**
* **Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills, well organized, excellent writing and communication skills.**
* **Superior interpersonal skills to motivate and lead others at all levels within a school.**
* **Demonstrates deep commitment to Teaching Matters’ mission, vision, and core values.**

**Presently Hiring Per diem**


**Per diem rates range up to-$640 per day with a $300 per day training rate. We are looking for someone who can commit to about two days per week, with options for additional days available. As this role will require travel, some travel support will be provided.**

title: Industrial Maintenance Technician- 1st Shift
description:
**Mechanic- 1st Shift**

**Your Role at Prestone**

*Our Freehold, NJ Plant is looking for a self-motivated, reliable, and detail-oriented Maintenance Technician to be part of our growing team. People that take the initiative and action to pursue production line goals and complete tasks. People that are thorough and accurate in accomplishing tasks. People that hold a high standard for safety, quality, production, and teamwork. If you are this person, we encourage you to apply!*

**What You’ll Be Doing**

**·**  Sets up production equipment to run scheduled production

· Discusses difficulties in operating equipment with machine operators to isolate problems, and then troubleshoots machine to determine cause and repairs required.

· Must be able to read and follow directions as found in technical manuals as well as be able to document any and all changes they are involved in. so as to refer back to the notes and records a thereby gain understanding as to how to set up lines an adjust machines and conveyors as needed.

· Performs necessary repairs on equipment to keep it in top running order.

· Must be able to perform major mechanical overhauls of some packaging equipment

· Carries out required preventative maintenance on equipment.

· Assists in determining required design modifications and makes approved modifications to equipment.

· Performs tasks in accordance with approved procedures and following all safety procedures and GMPs

· Provides coverage for mechanics on other shifts, as needed.

· Must be able to work with minimal supervision as well as in a team setting.

· Other duties as assigned

**What You’ll Bring**

* Minimum 4 years mechanical experience in a high-speed packaging and/or manufacturing environment
* Ability to stand and walk for periods of time
* Able to work scheduled overtime or shift changes when required
* Able to lift to 50 pounds periodically throughout the manufacturing shift and meet physical requirements of position including lifting, bending, standing for extended periods, reaching with both hands/arms, ability to visually inspect product
* Basic math skills
* Excellent communication skill set (verbal, written, etc.)

**What You Will Get**

Prestone offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits including health, wellness, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance. You can plan for your future with Prestone's retirement savings options including employer match. Prestone also recognizes the importance of continuing education and offers Education Assistance to our employees to encourage continued personal development and growth.

title: Experienced Pet Groomer
description:
Pawsability Dog Club is searching for an experienced Groomer for our mission-driven dog daycare! We are a new facility with a beautiful, spacious grooming space.

We are looking for a groomer to operate our grooming salon each weekend. Scheduling will be discussed with the selected candidate!

Our Grooming position is an independent contractor role. As such, you would let us know your preferred schedule, provide your own shears and tools, and maintain relationships with your client following. It is expected that the Groomer will provide top-quality care for clients from the initial dog intake, throughout their groom, to client pick-up and client-outreach to encourage recurring groom schedule. The groomer will have full use of the grooming space when on-site and will be expected to maintain that space in an organized, sanitary manner.

Each groomer works independently and does not have to share a room with another groomer.

Client's are booked every 2 hours to ensure an adequate amount of time to fulfill customer requests.

Requirements & Qualifications

1. Must have grooming certificate. A well balanced and exceptional portfolio can be substituted for a certificate.

2. Good oral & written communication skills

3. Minimum of 3 years professional grooming experience with history of satisfied, repeat clients. Please be prepared to show a portfolio of your work and provide a list of references.

4. Demonstrated ability to adhere to appointment schedule, interact favorably with clients, complete administrative notes/tasks to maintain satisfied client base. Reliability in both timelines and fulfilling commitments is key!

\\*\\*We will request final groomer candidates demonstrate grooming ability on a "test" dog prior to committing to work together.

5. Good decision and problem-solving skills. Must remain organized at all times and have superior time-management awareness.

title: Inspection Technician
description:
**Job Requirements**  

Momentum Solar is a premier residential solar provider with offices throughout the U.S. Founded in 2009, Momentum has grown exponentially over the past decade. We implement the entire solar process to ensure a seamless transition to renewable energy.

 **Overview**


The Inspection Technicians focus will be to provide a professional inspection for the Momentum design team for the preparation of photovoltaic projects as well as after the project is completed. This is an entry level position where the ideal candidate will be skilled, prideful in their craft, motivated and willing to learn. We are looking for a dependable candidate who will be able to maintain a high level of business ethics, professionalism and excelled communication between their Momentum team, customers and upper management.

 **Responsibilities:**

* Perform pre-inspection of system prior to inspectors arrival
* Open electrical panels and junction boxes so the inspector can observe
* Obtain necessary pictures and documents when needed
* Install place cards and label equipment
* Obtain final inspection stickers
* Set up and tie off ladders as necessary for city / county inspectors
* Build and maintain strong relationships with local inspection offices
* Work independently with minimum supervision
* Perform other job-related duties as assigned

 *Momentum is proud to be an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer*


Job Type: Full-time

  

Pay: $18.00 - $20.00 per hour

 **Work Experience**  

  

  

**Qualifications**

* A minimum of one (1) year experience in a discipline related to construction or building sciences; estimating or site assessment, PV, energy efficiency experience is preferred but not required
* High School or GED required
* Excellent customer service skills required
* Must be able to work unsupervised for extended periods of time
* Experience working in or around electric panels preferred
* Ability to organize and maintain paper documents, electronic photos, and files
* Excellent written communication skills are required when working with inspectors
* Ability to perform basic math with or without the use of an electronic device
* Proficiency with smart phone applications and digital cameras
* Basic computer skills including the ability to copy files and communicate via email
* Ability to read plans, specifications, diagrams, equipment submittals, and material data sheets
* Ability to follow standardized processes while working unassisted
* Ability to interact, communicate and provide detailed summaries of work performed to the homeowner and management team
* Ability to interact with co-workers and participate in daily/weekly meetings

 **Physical Requirements**

* Ability to safely and successfully perform the essential job functions for quality assurance - this includes but is not limited to:
* Ability to move any/all equipment as needed .
* Ability to work in extreme environments
* (example: hot sun, cold weather, snow, hot/cold attics and homes)
* Ability to operate office equipment including computers to determine accuracy of work performed
* Training will be provided

Our Retail Sales Technician role has big-time impact! If you enjoy helping people repair and get to know their tech devices, this role is for you. title: LPN - Urology
description:
**Essential Job functions**:

* Responsible for providing professional nursing care to the office patients in noncomplex situations under the supervision of Physician and Clinical Practice Manager or Clinical Coordinator.
* Delivers direct patient care within the scope of licensure and in accordance with SMG policy.
* Assumes accountability for the quality of care, which he/she has delivered including maintaining standard precautions.
* Maintains efficient patient flow.
* Collects lab specimens according to departmental guidelines. Accurately labels specimens.
* Prioritizes patient care by implementing physician orders and nursing procedures. Documents appropriately in the Electronic Health Record (EHR).
* Assures all patients are correctly identified prior to providing and/or documenting care.
* Communicates & provides care consistent with age, cultural, spiritual and developmental needs of the patient.
* Employs appropriate and timely use of Tasking in EHR.
* Schedules appointments appropriately and accurately according to department guidelines.
* Administers injections according to appropriate protocol. Documents injections accurately in HER
* Appropriately demonstrates telephone triage protocols and document in EHR.
* Effectively communicates problems, concerns or issues to the Office Supervisor/Manager appropriately and promptly.
* Ensures proper preparation for patient visit. Prepares pertinent information needed for patient visit.
* Obtains vital signs: BP, temp, pulse, height & weight accurately and completely as required. Documents appropriately in EHR.
* Reviews and updates medication list in EHR. Demonstrates understanding of prescription control and prescription refill procedures. Accurately and completely documents known allergies in EHR.
* Appropriately enters orders and schedules appointments in the Practice Management System (PMS) and EHR.
* Provides referrals and/or consult orders appropriately and in a timely manner in the PMS and EHR.
* Facilitates transition of care to UCC/Hospital.

**General Job functions:**

* Appropriately adheres to universal safety precautions when administering medications and disposal of medical waste.
* Maintains proficiency with department specific equipment troubleshoots and reports malfunctions promptly.
* Checks and maintains logs for emergency equipment according to policy.
* Assists in ordering and maintaining of all supplies as assigned.
* Demonstrates flexibility with various work schedules.
* Recognizes and performs duties which need to be performed although not directly assigned.

**Education, Certification, Computer and Training Requirements:**

* Vocational / Technical School / Diploma Program required. Associates degree preferred
* New Jersey State Nursing License and BLS certification required.
* 0 – 1 years experience. 2-4 years experience preferred.
* Ability to communicate in English, both orally and in writing.
* Strong interpersonal and organizational skills.
* Ability to prioritize and organize multiple tasks in a timely manner.
* Experience with Standard Office Equipment (Phone, Fax, Copy Machine, Scanner, Email/Voice Mail) preferred.
* Experience with Standard Office Technology in a Window based environment preferred.
* Experience with patient care equipment preferred.
* Experience with EHR, Practice Management System and Departmental/Ancillary Systems preferred.

**Travel**: Ability to commute to satellite offices as needed.

title: Instalador de Canaletas con experiencia - Gutter Installer
description:
**Instalador de Canaletas (Gutter Installer) – Debe poseer experiencia con maquina de canaletas**

**Detalles del trabajo:**

**Descripción de la empresa:**

Experiencia con máquinas de canaletas es indispensable – no aplique a esta posición si no la tiene.

Stern Gutters es una empresa contratista de canaletas en el norte de New Jersey.

Nos especializamos en el diseño de sistemas de canaleras personalizados, instalación de canaletas y protectores, y soluciones de reparación de sofito y fascia. Integridad, transparencia, y profesionalismo de primera categoría son el núcleo de todo lo que hacemos. Aunque estamos ubicados en el condado de Essex, brindamos servicios a las comunidad a nuestro alrededor, incluyendo los condados de Bergen, Passaic, Morris, Somerset, Union, Middlesex, y Hudson.

**Descripción de la posición:**

Estamos buscando un instalador de Canaletas hábil y experimentado para unirse a nuestro equipo de instaladores. El candidato ideal tendrá experiencia sólida en instalación, reparación y mantenimiento de canaletas, o experiencia práctica de carpintería. Experiencia con una máquina de fabricación de canaletas es un requisito indispensable.

Debe ser detallista, consciente de la seguridad y capaz de trabajar en equipo y seguir las instrucciones del líder del equipo. Si eres nativo o fluido en español, esto puede ser una gran ventaja.

**Responsabilidades:**

- Instalar, reparar y mantener canaletas, bajantes y protectores de canaletas según los estándares de la industria y las políticas de la empresa.

- Inspeccionar y evaluar los sistemas de canaletas para identificar problemas o áreas que necesiten reparación o reemplazo.

- Medir, cortar, y dar forma a las canaletas para que se ajusten a dimensiones específicas y asegurar un flujo de agua adecuado.

- Operar de manera segura herramientas manuales y eléctricas, incluyendo taladros, sierras y escaleras, para completar los proyectos de instalación.

- Colaborar con los miembros del equipo y los líderes de proyectos para coordinar el flujo de trabajo y asegurar completar el proyecto en el tiempo esperado.

- Seguir los protocolos y pautas de seguridad para prevenir accidentes y mantener un ambiente de trabajo seguro.

- Comunicarse efectivamente con los clientes para responder sus preguntas y preocupaciones, y proporcionar recomendaciones según sea necesario.

- Mantener registros correctos del trabajo realizado, materiales utilizados y horas trabajadas para fines de facturación y reporte de trabajo

- Entrenar a los nuevos integrantes del equipo y a los técnicos menos experimentados que acompañan a los equipos en los trabajos del día.

**Requisitos:**

- Experiencia comprobada como instalador de canaletas con un mínimo de 3 años en la industria.

- Familiaridad con sistemas de canaletas, materiales y técnicas de instalación.

Únete a nuestro equipo y se parte de una empresa que valora la integridad, el trabajo de obra y la satisfacción del cliente.

title: Associate Director of Admissions
description:
**Associate Director of Admissions**

**DEPARTMENT: Admissions**

**REPORTS TO: Director of Admissions**

**RESPONSIBLE FOR: Admissions**

**WORKING PATTERN : Full time, salaried, 40-hour work week, Monday to Friday** (Some weekend and out-of-hours work may be required)

**ISSUE/REVISION DATE: August 2024**

**START DATE: October 28, 2024**

**SALARY RANGE: $65,000 - $70,000**

**ABOUT US:**

Harrow International School New York is situated on a stunning campus covering more than 100 acres in Long Island, New York. Harrow New York caters to both boarding and day students from the local region, across the United States, and internationally. The school offers a bespoke and challenging academic curriculum, combined with pastoral care of the highest standard and an outstanding co-curricular program. All rooted in the Harrow core values of Courage, Honor, Humility and Fellowship. Harrow New York equips its students with character, resilience, and adaptability to flourish and be of good influence in the world that awaits them.

All members of staff work to a single, uniting purpose: to prepare students with diverse backgrounds and abilities for a life of learning, leadership, service, and personal fulfilment.

**ABOUT THE ROLE**

The post-holder is required to be present full-time on campus and, in tandem with the Director of Admissions and the Senior Leadership Team (SLT), supports all aspects of the admissions process. This includes handling applications, conducting tours and interview processes, communicating with prospective families and sending schools or consultants, coordinating appointments, aligning daily procedures, and planning and orchestrating special events.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES**

This job description reflects the core activities of the role and is subject to change as the department and the post-holder develop. The School expects the post-holder to recognize this and adopt a flexible approach. In addition, the post-holder will be expected to undertake other duties within the scope of the role, as required by the line manager.

The Associate Director of Admissions will work closely with the Director of Admissions, the Admissions Team, and the Senior Leadership Team as a representative of our School, to ensure effective implementation of the School’s brand and messaging.

* Demonstrate the value of a Harrow New York education to prospective families, and serve as a champion and guide throughout the admissions process
* Ensure that all aspects of the applicant journey are delivered to the highest standard
* Actively support the values, vision, ethos, culture and policies of the School
* Inspire and motivate students, teachers, and other school employees
* Contribute to the effective marketing of the School, meeting parents, conducting tours, and leading promotional events as needed
* Support and attend all major school events
* Build and maintain effective external relationships with local schools, community organizations, and educational consultants promoting and representing the School at a local, national, and international level
* Keep an open mind to innovative ways of contributing to student recruitment, working collaboratively with the Admissions Team and the SLT to meet enrollment targets
* Adhere to principles of good practice in admissions
* Coordinate with the Head of IT and Systems to support needs for presentations or events
* Collaborate with the Director of Marketing and Communications to support needs for admissions presentations, events, visuals, virtual materials, virtual tours, or invitations
* Have familiarity with and ability to learn the School’s online platforms, including but not limited to Finalsite, iSAMS, SSS Community Brands and Microsoft Office
* Accompany the Director of Admissions (or attend in their absence) on school visits or meetings, as appropriate
* Actively upkeep tour training
* Communicate with schools, consultants, and families as a representative in the absence of the Director of Admissions, as required
* Field parent and student questions, offering quality answers both promptly and compassionately
* Monitor inquiries and respond in a timely fashion
* Liaise with the SLT during family campus visits and group tours or events
* Assist with the gathering, maintenance and analysis of the School’s admissions and applications statistics
* Assist in planning and supporting recruitment and retention events for admissions
* Represent the School at fairs and admissions events, both locally and regionally

**Interview and campus visit process** 

* Oversee Harrow Test process
* Oversee arrangements for family tours, interviews, phone calls
* Streamline the process of on-site parent and student interviews, alongside the SLT
* Create a smooth flow for on-campus visits
* Conduct interviews with prospective students and families and provide tours to parents and students alongside the SLT
* Prepare for on-campus family visits, including assessment set-up arrangements, marketing materials, brochures, videos, refreshments for visitors, and sharing responsibility for filing notes and results
* Liaise with the Admissions Team and the SLT to collect and upload interview notes and any assessment results

**Administration** 

* Collaborate with the Admissions Team on the application and enrollment process through Finalsite
* Assist in proofing policies, documents, and communications
* Share responsibilities for the operational aspects of the Admissions Team and oversee the on-campus office, including answering emails and/or phone calls
* Help manage the logistics of the entire application process, including contract and enrollment deadlines
* Inventory files and notify applicants as needed

**Finance** 

* Respond to invoice requests related to Admissions
* Coordinate with the Head of HR and Finance regarding student payments and billing via Finalsite
* Help manage and review the Admissions budget
* Be responsible for professional membership renewals and corresponding invoices

**PERSON SPECIFICATION – ASSOCIATE DIRECTOR OF ADMISSIONS**

All staff are expected to conduct themselves in line with the School’s values: Courage, Honor, Humility and Fellowship. Post-holders will be expected to demonstrate the following:

**PROFESSIONAL QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE**

* Have significant prior admissions experience at a private school with a background in education and working with students
* Be accustomed to a collaborative office environment
* Have prior experience working with SEVIS and Financial Aid
* Hold a bachelor's degree or higher
* Be able to commit to a full-time, in-person working pattern in Oakdale, NY

**LEADERSHIP AND PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES** 

* Be a positive, knowledgeable spokesperson
* Be pragmatic and able to respond to changing situations
* Demonstrate a strong work ethic
* Possess excellent external and internal written and oral communication skills and relationship-building abilities
* Be efficient, prompt, and responsive

**HOW TO APPLY**

To be considered for this role, Harrow New York requires all applicants to demonstrate their qualifications and experience by submitting the following documents by **12pm EDT** on **Wednesday August 28, 2024**:

* Cover letter introducing yourself to the Harrow New York search committee and highlighting your specific interest in joining the Harrow New York Community
* CV/Resume
* Two Professional References: Include each person’s name, current organization, title, phone number, email, and connection to you. We will not contact any references without obtaining your permission

**SELECTION PROCESS**

Shortlisted applicants will be invited to attend an online screening interview. Selected candidates will then be invited to attend a second interview in person.

*Harrow New York reserves the right to make an earlier appointment.*

*This position is subject to an enhanced background check. In addition, the position will be offered subject to the receipt of satisfactory references and proof of right to work in the US.* 

*Harrow New York is committed to the safety and protection of children. All employees are expected to comply with our School Child Protection and Safeguarding Policy.* 

*Harrow New York is an equal opportunity employer and provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, and local laws.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Account Manager
description:
Intapp is expanding the sales organization with an Account Manager within Financial Services - Investment Banking vertical.
What you will do:* Own overall relationship with assigned clients, which will include ensuring retention and satisfaction.
* Establish a trusted/strategic advisor relationship with each assigned client and drive continued value of our products and services.
* Work to identify, develop, and close upsell and cross-sell opportunities to meet targets.
* Acting as a representative to maintain positive relationships with all employees, customers, partners, and shareholders.
* Work with clients to establish critical goals, or other key performance indicators and aid the customer in achieving their goals.
* Providing timely and positive resolution of escalated sales-related issues
* Communicating with key customers, business partners and executives on significant issues and accomplishments.

What you will need:* 5+ years of account management experience in software industry or the Investment Banking vertical
* Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets.
* Strong interpersonal communication skills and ability to achieve set goals and deadlines
* Natural leadership skills, and ability to mobilize people towards a goal
* Ability to pick up new technologies easily
* Good understanding of Excel, financial modeling, and financial reporting
* Experience with Salesforce or other CRM platforms
* Prior experience in closing sales deals at the executive level a plus
* Knowledge of the private equity and financial services investment banking market preferred

What you will gain at Intapp:
Our culture at Intapp emphasizes accountability, responsibility, and growth. We support each other in a positive, open atmosphere that fosters creativity, approachability, and teamwork. We’re committed to creating a modern work environment that’s connected yet flexible, supporting both professional success and work-life balance. title: Vice President, Sales Real Assets
description:
At Intapp we deliver industry-cloud solutions for the financial and professional services markets with an unwavering commitment to becoming the definitive leader in Applied AI. Our industry clouds are collections of cloud software, integration capabilities, and features and tools designed to deliver sector-specific experience, modernized for partners and professionals working in our core markets. Our Industry Cloud Blueprints are built with a collaborative approach, using cross functional teams to deliver a highly relevant configuration of our technology that is differentiated from what is available today from large horizontal software vendors.  

Intapp is looking for a Vice President to lead our Sales Real Assets team that will be part of our Financial Services GTM Leadership team. The VP, Sales Real Assets will have a broad scope of responsibilities including setting market and product strategies, developing business and operating plans and team development. They will collaborate closely with Intapp leadership and our GTM teams to drive strategy and execution of Industry segment business and operating plans for commercial success and sales.  

The VP, Sales Real Assets will work closely with other leaders and counterparts across all relevant functions including Intapp’s GMs, sales, client success, product, engineering, alliances, marketing, services, and support groups. They will ensure that all teams are aligned and fully informed with respect to market needs and priorities to ensure Intapp’s Real Assets solutions are best of breed and optimized to succeed in the market. They will lead the industry strategy and directly impact the revenue growth of the Real Assets business segment for the platform while ensuring our Industry solutions and Applied AI product strategy continues to set Intapp apart in the marketplace.  

What You’ll Do:* Developing and executing a revenue growth plan for each account and line of business for the Real Assets Markets.
* Cultivating relationships with the most senior, pedigreed, and accomplished executives of leading Real Assets Investment firms.
* Selling to the staff support teams that evaluate, install, and manage technology and business solutions within these firms.
* Managing existing subscription revenue to avoid undue revenue churn and ACV loss.
* Mapping this complex buying dynamic and retention cycle and to maintain long-term successful relationships with these prominent clients.
* Serve as the lead executive Real Assets industry expert in communicating the value proposition to prospective and existing clients and help the go to market team close new business.
* Build and maintain key executive-level relationships with clients and partners in the industry to support our strategy and client development.
* Meet or speak with Real Assets prospective clients on a regular basis to ensure that we are fully aware of issues and opportunities to improve the solution and/or processes.
* Lead the definition of the industry blueprints and help build out the business segment for the platform.
* Refine and build out the TAM for the Real Assets solution.
* Help identify and advocate for potential strategic M & A to grow our technology, offerings, clients, or talent in the target industry.
* Work with the platform product management team to prioritize the Real Assets roadmap.
* Work with Marketing group to:


o Define the solution and go to market messaging for the different segments for the market.
o Define specific campaigns to target the different segments with the market.* Work with the implementation team to refine the out of the box industry blueprints.

  

What You’ll Need:* Experience at Real Assets firms as an Advisory Partner or equivalent
* Experience in significant executive level role with software firm(s) of scale that serve and sell to the Real Assets industry.
* Natural leader with experience as a leader in large matrixed organizations where cross- functional indirect influence leadership has been a part of your success.
* Team player with ability to coordinate work across varied functions and teams to drive alignment.
* Communicate as needed with engineering, product, and support teams to make sure teams are aligned and working to optimize the solution and related processes.
* Capability to present value propositions to C-level and board-level executives.
* Excellent executive written and verbal communication, and presentation skills are a must; this position involves a significant amount of direct executive client interaction.
* Results-oriented, resourceful, and comfortable working under tight deadlines with demanding internal and external customers.
* Flexibility to travel globally as needed.

  

Ideal If You Have:* Industry experience including time in seat as an investor or advisor.
* Existing network in the industry that can be leveraged for knowledge and sales leads.

  

What you will gain at Intapp:
Our culture at Intapp emphasizes accountability, responsibility, and growth. We support each other in a positive, open atmosphere that fosters creativity, approachability, and teamwork. We’re committed to creating a modern work environment that’s connected yet flexible, supporting both professional success and work-life balance. In return for your passion, commitment, and collaborative approach, we offer:* Competitive base salary plus variable compensation and equity
* Generous paid parental leave, including adoptive leave
* Traditional comprehensive benefits, plus:
	+ Generous Paid Time Off
	+ Tuition reimbursement plan
	+ Family Formation benefit offered by Carrot
	+ Wellness programs and benefits provided by Modern Health
	+ Paid volunteer time off and donation matching for the causes you care about

* An open, collaborative environment where your background and contributions are valued
* Experience at a growing public company where you can make an impact and achieve your goals
* Open offices and kitchens stocked with beverages and snacks

title: Junior Accountant
description:
GENERAL DESCRIPTION

The City University Construction Fund (CUCF) is a New York State public benefit corporation that manages the $3 billion capital construction program for the design and construction of space required to support the educational mandate of the City University of New York (CUNY).

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Reporting to the Controller of FPCM, the Junior Accountant will be responsible for the following:

* Processing accounts payable invoices and expense claims for payment by matching and verifying with purchase orders, requisitions, packing slips, vendor statements, and receipts into the New York City Financial Management System (FMS) and the New York State Statewide Financial System (SFS)
* Preparing entries, including adjustments, closings, and reclassifications in the City University Construction Fund (CUCF) ledger as part of the monthly and annual close process
* Preparing trial balances, bank reconciliations, balance sheet reconciliations, operating statements, and financial schedules
* Maintaining spreadsheets to support financial transactions and analyses of various expenditures

Other Duties

Work on special projects, and other related duties

QUALIFICATIONS AND CORE COMPETENCIES

**Minimum Qualifications**

* Bachelor of Arts or Bachelor of Science degree in accounting, business administration, or finance from an accredited college
* Minimum of two years of experience in accounts payable.
* Experience with accounts payable processes and financial management systems.
* Accounting experience in general accounting and/or financial reporting, including journal entries and account reconciliations
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Accounting experience in a New York City or New York State publicly funded organization

**Core Competencies**

* Excellent written and verbal communication
* Ability to work on multiple design and construction projects at one time
* Excellent organizational skills and the ability to multi-task
* Ability to work under pressure and to meet multiple deadlines
* Ability to prioritize competing work
* Self and team motivator
* Ability to be a team player
* Ability to set project priorities and adjust implementation strategies
* Ability to work effectively with staff, associates, and internal and external constituents
* Knowledgeable of capital and operating budgets
* Alert and observant and looking for ways to improve processes
* Out-of-the-box thinker, creative, inventive, and adaptable to situations

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Physical Setting:

* Office

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

* accounts payable: 2 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY 10019 (Required)

title: IT Specialist (Customer Support), GS-07/GS-09
company: United States Military Academy, Chief Information Officer/G6 (CIO/G6)
description:
**Job Title:** Information Technology Specialist (Customer Support)

**Series:** 2210

**Pay Plan & Grade:** GS-07/09

**Department:** Department of the Army

**Agency:** U.S. Army Military Academy

**Salary Range:** $57,594.00 to $91,582.00

**Promotion Potential:** GS-09

**Duty Location:** West Point, New York

**Appointment Type:** Competitive Service - Permanent  
**Work Schedule:** Full-Time

**Who May Apply:** U.S. Citizens

**This position is being filled under the Direct Hire Authority for Certain Personnel of the DoD Workforce.** 

Civilian employees serve a vital role in supporting the Army mission. They provide the skills that are not readily available in the military, but crucial to support military operations. The Army integrates the talents and skills of its military and civilian members to form a Total Army.

The Army values diversity of perspectives, backgrounds, cultures and skills, which connects employees to organizations that are committed to building an inclusive work environment where they can contribute to their fullest potential.

**Marketing Link:** 

https://westpoint.edu/

**About the Position:** 

The U.S. Military Academy, West Point, NY is an academic institution located in the Hudson River Valley, 50 miles from New York City. The historic site is the oldest continuously occupied military post in America. West Point is a self-contained city with housing, a Department of Public Works, libraries, hospital, fire department, chapels, and restaurants. Employees have access to Eisenhower Hall Theater, Hudson Valley's performing arts center, and recreational facilities.

**Duties:**

· Provides technical advice and assistance to users (cadets) in utilizing automated data systems and the associated automated data processing equipment (ADPE).

· Identifies hardware versus software problems and performs the required corrective action.

· Serves as the first line technical expert on the maintenance and troubleshooting of network connectivity, hardware and software problems on cadet mobile devices, laptops and peripherals.

· Serves as Help Desk support personnel for the United States Military Academy (USMA) cadets.

· Provides expertise on peripheral equipment and hardware devices, and data communications devices to detect and resolve hardware problems.

· Installs new or replaces bad customer replaceable units such as memory chips, internal batteries or SSDs on personal computers, laptop computers, monitors, or other peripheral devices where necessary.

· Performs preventive maintenance on the USMA cadet computer systems, including cleaning the boards, heat sinks and fan, and interface connections, as required.

· Updates instructions for software, hardware, and peripheral configuration/installation, both on the network and standalone, to reflect the changing technology to include essential tips on how to avoid breakdowns before they occur and shortcuts for troubleshooting a variety of problems encountered at the workstation and server levels.

· Conducts one on one training on Office 365 desktop and web applications, E-mail, and other desktop software procedures.

· Responds to users' notification of computer virus infection and uses standard software tools to clean the personal computer and ensure that the problem is adequately contained.

**Conditions of Employment:**

· Appointment to this position is subject to a background investigation to determine the incumbent's suitability for Federal employment.

· This position requires the incumbent to obtain and maintain required certifications (Level II, Security+ CE or Alternative) in accordance with Department of Defense Publication 8570.01-M Information Assurance Workshop Improvement Program within 6 months of entry into the position.

· This position has a requirement to lift up to 45 pounds in the regular performance of duties.

· This position may require a pre-employment physical.

· This position may require the incumbent to work an alternate work schedule.

· Appointment to this position is subject to a two year probationary period unless the appointee has previously met the requirements as described in 5 CFR Part 315.

**Qualifications:**

In order to qualify, you must meet the education and/or experience requirements described below. Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community; student; social). You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience. Your resume must clearly describe your relevant experience; if qualifying based on education, your transcripts will be required as part of your application.

**GS-07****:**

Specialized and Other Experience: One year of specialized experience which includes 1) assisting in installing, configuring, troubleshooting, and/or maintaining customer hardware or software; and 2) assisting in resolving problems in response to customer reported incidents. This definition of specialized experience is typical of work performed at the second lower grade/level position in the federal service (GS-05).

The specialized experience must include, or be supplemented by, information technology related experience (paid or unpaid experience and/or completion of specific, intensive training, as appropriate) which demonstrates each of the four competencies, as defined:

(1) Attention to Detail – Is thorough when performing work and conscientious about attending to detail. Examples of IT-related experience demonstrating this competency include: completing work independently that rarely requires editing or review by others.

(2) Customer Service – Works with clients and customers (that is, any individuals who use or receive the services or products that your work unit produces, including the general public, individuals who work in the agency, other agencies, or organizations outside the Government) to assess their needs, provide information or assistance, resolve their problems, or satisfy their expectations; knows about available products and services; is committed to providing quality products and services. Examples of IT-related experience demonstrating this competency include: resolving simple and routine problems, questions, or complaints and providing support and guidance to customers on non-routine issues; serving as a primary resource for customers, requesting assistance with complex issues when necessary; and participating in meetings and providing advice to customers in own area of expertise.

(3) Oral Communication – Expresses information (for example, ideas or facts) to individuals or groups effectively, taking into account the audience and nature of the information (for example, technical, sensitive, controversial); makes clear and convincing oral presentations; listens to others, attends to nonverbal cues, and responds appropriately. Examples of IT-related experience demonstrating this competency include: expressing facts and ideas in a clear, concise, convincing, and organized manner; clearly conveying moderately complex ideas, concepts, and information to customers; exhibiting active listening by demonstrating understanding of audience comments and/or questions.

(4) Problem Solving – Identifies problems; determines accuracy and relevance of information; uses sound judgment to generate and evaluate alternatives, and to make recommendations. Examples of IT-related experience demonstrating this competency include: identifying and solving problems by gathering and applying information from a variety of materials or sources that provide several alternatives; recognizing and taking action to address non-routine problems; soliciting feedback from multiple stakeholders to understand an issue or problem and accurately assess its root causes and potential solutions; seeking supervisory review where appropriate.

-OR-

Education: One full year of graduate level education from an accredited or pre-accredited institution in computer science, engineering, information science, information systems management, mathematics, operations research, statistics, or technology management; or, graduate level education from an accredited or pre-accredited institution that provided a minimum of 24 semester hours in one or more of the fields identified above and required the development or adaptation of applications, systems, or networks.

-OR-

Superior Academic Achievement: Successful completion of all the requirements for a bachelor’s degree from an accredited or pre-accredited institution in computer science, engineering, information science, information systems management, mathematics, operations research, statistics, or technology management; or, bachelor’s degree from an accredited or pre-accredited institution that provided a minimum of 24 semester hours in one or more of the fields identified above and required the development or adaptation of applications, systems, or networks. Superior Academic Achievement is based on: (1) Class Standing - You must be in the upper third of the graduating class in the college, university, or major subdivision, such as the College of Liberal Arts or the School of Business Administration, based on completed courses; OR (2) Grade-Point Average (G.P.A.) - You must have a grade-point average of either (a) 3.0 or higher out of a possible 4.0 ("B" or better) as recorded on your official transcript, or as computed based on 4 years of education, or as computed based on courses completed during the final 2 years of the curriculum; or (b) 3.5 or higher out of a possible 4.0 ("B+" or better) based on the average of the required courses completed in the major field or the required courses in the major field completed during the final 2 years of the curriculum.; OR (3) Honor Society Membership - You may be considered eligible based on membership in one of the approved national scholastic honor societies listed by the Association of College Honor Societies (https://www.achsnatl.org/).

**GS-09****:**

Specialized and Other Experience: One year of specialized experience which includes 1) installing, configuring, troubleshooting, and/or maintaining customer hardware or software; 2) researching or resolving problems in response to customer reported incidents; and 3) advising customers on the basic use or operation of information technology hardware or software. This definition of specialized experience is typical of work performed at the second lower grade/level position in the federal service (GS-07).

The specialized experience must include, or be supplemented by, information technology related experience (paid or unpaid experience and/or completion of specific, intensive training, as appropriate) which demonstrates each of the four competencies, as defined:

(1) Attention to Detail – Is thorough when performing work and conscientious about attending to detail. Examples of IT-related experience demonstrating this competency include: completing work independently that rarely requires editing or review by others.

(2) Customer Service – Works with clients and customers (that is, any individuals who use or receive the services or products that your work unit produces, including the general public, individuals who work in the agency, other agencies, or organizations outside the Government) to assess their needs, provide information or assistance, resolve their problems, or satisfy their expectations; knows about available products and services; is committed to providing quality products and services. Examples of IT-related experience demonstrating this competency include: resolving simple and routine problems, questions, or complaints and providing support and guidance to customers on non-routine issues; serving as a primary resource for customers, requesting assistance with complex issues when necessary; and participating in meetings and providing advice to customers in own area of expertise.

(3) Oral Communication – Expresses information (for example, ideas or facts) to individuals or groups effectively, taking into account the audience and nature of the information (for example, technical, sensitive, controversial); makes clear and convincing oral presentations; listens to others, attends to nonverbal cues, and responds appropriately. Examples of IT-related experience demonstrating this competency include: expressing facts and ideas in a clear, concise, convincing, and organized manner; clearly conveying moderately complex ideas, concepts, and information to customers; exhibiting active listening by demonstrating understanding of audience comments and/or questions.

(4) Problem Solving – Identifies problems; determines accuracy and relevance of information; uses sound judgment to generate and evaluate alternatives, and to make recommendations. Examples of IT-related experience demonstrating this competency include: identifying and solving problems by gathering and applying information from a variety of materials or sources that provide several alternatives; recognizing and taking action to address non-routine problems; soliciting feedback from multiple stakeholders to understand an issue or problem and accurately assess its root causes and potential solutions; seeking supervisory review where appropriate.

-OR-

Education: Master’s or equivalent graduate degree or 2 full years of progressively higher level graduate education leading to such a degree from an accredited or pre-accredited institution in computer science, engineering, information science, information systems management, mathematics, operations research, statistics, or technology management; or, two full years of graduate education from an accredited or pre-accredited institution that provided a minimum of 24 semester hours in one or more of the fields identified above and required the development or adaptation of applications, systems, or networks.

**Education:**

**FOREIGN EDUCATION:** If you are using education completed in foreign colleges or universities to meet the qualification requirements, you must show the education credentials have been evaluated by a private organization that specializes in interpretation of foreign education programs and such education has been deemed equivalent to that gained in an accredited U.S. education program; or full credit has been given for the courses at a U.S. accredited college or university. For further information, visit: http://www.ed.gov/about/offices/list/ous/international/usnei/us/edlite-visitus-forrecog.html

**Other Information:**

· Male applicants born after December 31, 1959, must complete a Pre-Employment Certification Statement for Selective Service Registration.

· You will be required to provide proof of U.S. Citizenship.

· Two year trial/probationary period may be required.

· Direct Deposit of Pay is required.

* This is a Digital Technology Career Field (CF) position.

· Multiple positions may be filled from this announcement.

· Salary includes applicable locality pay or Local Market Supplement.

· Veterans and Military Spouses will be considered along with all other candidates.

· Payment of Permanent Change of Station (PCS) costs is not authorized, based on a determination that a PCS move is not in the Government interest.

· **This position is not eligible for regular and recurring telework. This position is eligible for situational telework only, including emergency and OPM prescribed "unscheduled telework". Situational telework is sometimes also referred to as episodic, intermittent, unscheduled, or ad-hoc telework. Situational telework is approved on a case-by-case basis, where the hours worked were not part of a previously approved, ongoing, and regular telework schedule.**

**Required Documents:**

**1. Your resume:**

· Your resume may be submitted in any format and must support the specialized experience described in this announcement.

· If your resume includes a photograph or other inappropriate material or content, it will not be used to make eligibility and qualification determinations and you may not be considered for this vacancy.

· For qualifications determinations your resume must contain hours worked per week and the dates of employment (i.e., HRS per week and month/year to month/year or month/year to present). If your resume does not contain this information, your application may be marked as incomplete and you may not receive consideration for this position.

**2. Academic Transcripts**

· This position has an individual occupational requirement and/or allows for substitution of education for experience. If you meet this requirement based on education you MUST submit a copy of your transcript with your application package or you will be rated ineligible

**3. Other supporting documents:**

Applicants may also submit the following supporting document type(s), which may not be required for all applicants:

· DD-214, for verification of veterans’ status.

· Statement of service from your unit, if currently serving on active duty.

· Copy of Sponsor's Permanent Change of Station orders and marriage certificate, for verification of military spouse status.

NOTE: Documents submitted as part of the application package, to include supplemental documents, may be shared beyond the Human Resources Office. Some supplemental documents such as military orders and marriage certificates may contain personal information for someone other than you. You may sanitize these documents to remove another person's personal information before you submit your application. You may be asked to provide an un-sanitized version of the documents if you are selected to confirm your eligibility.

title: Home Repair Technician
description:
**COMPANY OVERVIEW:** We are **UNIVERSE HOME SERVICES**, a Long Island proud local business, assisting homeowners with their HVAC, Plumbing and Electrical needs for over 70 years throughout Nassau and Suffolk counties. We are consistently growing in terms of services, employees, and customers, and with that growth we have maintained valued employees for over 20 years!

**GENERAL JOB DESCRIPTION:** We are seeking a skilled and reliable home repair technician. The ideal candidate will be responsible for performing various repair and maintenance tasks in residential properties, ensuring they are in excellent condition. This role requires a strong knowledge of home repair techniques, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to work independently.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:** 

* Perform general home repairs and maintenance tasks, including but not limited to carpentry, painting, and drywall repair.
* Repair issues in homes and determine the best solutions.
* Expertise in multiple types of home repair, maintenance and remodeling.
* Basic construction skills.
* General carpentry – rough and finish.
* Painting interior and exterior.
* Drywall repair/patching/caulking.
* Assist with emergency repairs and be available for on-call duty as required.
* Provide excellent customer service to homeowners, addressing their concerns professionally and courteously.
* Maintain and organized and clean work area.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* High School Diploma or equivalent.
* Proven experience as a home repair technician or in a similar maintenance role.
* Thorough understanding of residential maintenance and home repair including carpentry and construction techniques
* Proficiency in using hand and power tools.
* Highly organized, able to think proactively with attention to detail, able to maintain multiple priorities simultaneously.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work independently.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $23.30 - $33.00 per hour

Expected hours: No less than 40 per week

* Do you have at least 2 years of Home Repair experience?
