title: Part Time Associate banker (20 Hour ) Sixth Ave and 23rd St, NY, NY
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  


We have an obsession for taking care of our customers and employees and making them feel welcomed and valued through building lasting relationships, doing the right thing, exceeding expectations, and having a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Using the latest banking solutions combined with cutting-edge financial technology and the most welcoming and friendly service, you will be front and center representing our brand and culture. You will have the opportunity to help people experience our Customer Promise - helping people make the most of their money so they can make the most of their lives, by providing education, and advice tailored to suit their financial needs.  

  

As an Associate Banker in Branch Banking, you will contribute significantly to the success of the branch by delivering exceptional customer experiences. You will build long-lasting relationships with clients by sharing product knowledge and solutions as well as introducing them to our licensed bankers.  

  

**Job responsibilities**
* Engages clients as they enter the branch by welcoming them and making them feel appreciated, including managing lobby traffic, checking clients into the waiting queue and scheduling/canceling client meetings
* Helps clients with everyday transactions such as deposits, withdrawals, payments, reordering a debit card, setting up a direct deposit or helping update their address accurately and efficiently, while complying with all policies, procedures, and regulatory and banking requirements
* Educates clients on the usage of technology self-service options such as leveraging the Chase Mobile App, Chase.com, and ATMs to complete their banking needs whenever, wherever, and however they want
* Assists clients and the branch team by helping with new account openings when needed
* Performs branch operations which may include managing cash devices such as the cash vault, ATM, or others while adhering to all bank policies and procedures
**Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills**
* 6+ months of customer service experience
* High school diploma or GED equivalent
**Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills*** Ability to make personal connections, engage customers, and remain courteous and professional in a team environment while quickly and accurately learn products, services, and procedures
* Professional, interpersonal, thorough, detailed oriented, and organized with follow-up skills
* Strong desire and ability to influence, educate, and connect customers to technology
* Cash handling experience
  
  

**ABOUT US**  

Chase is a leading financial services firm, helping nearly half of America’s households and small businesses achieve their financial goals through a broad range of financial products. Our mission is to create engaged, lifelong relationships and put our customers at the heart of everything we do. We also help small businesses, nonprofits and cities grow, delivering solutions to solve all their financial needs.


We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set, and location. For those in eligible roles, discretionary incentive compensation which may be awarded in recognition of individual achievements and contributions. We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage, on-site health and wellness centers, a retirement savings plan, backup childcare, tuition reimbursement, mental health support, financial coaching and more. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided during the hiring process.


We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.


Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans

  

  

  

**ABOUT THE TEAM**  


Our Consumer & Community Banking division serves our Chase customers through a range of financial services, including personal banking, credit cards, mortgages, auto financing, investment advice, small business loans and payment processing. We’re proud to lead the U.S. in credit card sales and deposit growth and have the most-used digital solutions – all while ranking first in customer satisfaction.  

  

Our Consumer Banking group helps customers manage their money with checking, savings and credit cards, combining the latest banking technology with comprehensive solutions to meet the financial needs of nearly half of U.S. households.

title: Media Relations Associate
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

Positions within JP Morgan Chase provide numerous opportunities for meaningful growth in a firm dedicated to inclusivity, development, mobility and career advancement. We are hiring best-in-class talent who are passionate entrepreneurial and want to work in a globally diverse organization with a strong culture.


As a Media Relations Associate for the Asset Wealth Management team you will report to the Private Bank Head of Media Relations for the Americas. In this role, you will manage regional communications and media relations for the U.S. Private Bank, which has offices across the country.

**Job responsibilities:**

* Develop and execute comprehensive public relations strategies that align with our business themes and objectives.
* Manage media relations and provide external communications support for the U.S. Private Bank's offices and executives across the country.
* Achieve visibility in trade and local publications, and top-tier mainstream media for our key themes and thought leadership; and collaborate with our social media team to extend coverage to LinkedIn.
* Create content for contributed pieces, draft press releases, and coordinate media events; coach U.S. Private Bank executives to effectively communicate with the press.
* Support organized scheduling for a variety of spokespeople.
* Manage and develop productive relationships with wealth management, markets, and investment beat reporters.
* Monitor, analyze, and showcase media coverage and results in a disciplined and strategic fashion.
* Represent J.P. Morgan U.S. Private Bank PR at internal business meetings.
* Develop and maintain client relationships at senior leadership levels, ensuring effective communication and strategy alignment.
* Contribute to strategy development and execution, ensuring alignment with business goals and objectives.
* Partner closely with the firm's Regional Corporate Communications team to execute in-market media activity and promote cross-line of business storytelling.

**Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills:**

* 4+ years of media relations experience – in an in-house or PR agency setting (Account Executive or similar level) – with experience in the financial services space.
* Bachelor’s degree in Public Relations, Journalism, Media Studies, or a similar degree.
* Experience in all aspects of Public Relations: from creating and presenting a strategy, to writing pitches, pitching, securing opportunities, managing interviews or events, monitoring, and presenting results on a regular basis.
* Exceptional project management and organizational skills required, including the ability to strategically prioritize multiple assignments.
* Ability to proactively pursue and achieve press activity.
* Strong writing and editing abilities, strong eye for detail, and strong communication skills.
* Ability to create and sustain productive relationships with the media, coupled with an uncompromising commitment to ethics and treating journalists with respect.
* Comfortable working in a corporate, business professional environment, with the ability to manage clients at senior leadership levels and work across a large and complex corporation.
* Enthusiastic, keen to learn, self-motivated individual, with an excellent work ethic.
* Happy to be part of a small but industrious in-house team which serves a diverse client base, a collaborative team player.




J.P. Morgan Private Bank has offices across the United States, providing a broad network for media relations and communications activities. This role offers an exciting opportunity to manage and enhance the visibility of our Private Bank's presence nationwide.

title: Quantitative Trader - Executive Director
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION** **Position Summary:**


As a highly skilled Quantitative Trader for the Americas Rates team, you will possess a strong foundation in mathematics, statistics, and computer science, coupled with a deep understanding of financial markets. This role involves developing, testing, and implementing quantitative trading strategies, while managing risk and maximizing returns.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Develop and implement quantitative trading models, algorithms, and strategies.
* Conduct in-depth research and analysis of financial markets, instruments, and data.
* Backtest and optimize trading strategies using historical data and advanced statistical techniques.
* Collaborate with the development team to build and maintain trading systems.
* Monitor market conditions and adjust trading strategies accordingly.
* Perform risk analysis and implement risk management procedures.
* Contribute to the development of new trading ideas and research initiatives.

**Required qualifications, capabilities and skills:**

* Advanced degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, or a related field.
* Strong programming skills in Python, C++, or similar languages.
* In-depth knowledge of statistical modeling, machine learning, and optimization techniques.
* Proven experience in quantitative trading or financial modeling.
* Strong understanding of financial markets, instruments, and derivatives.
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Minimum of 3 years of demonstrated experience in generating of trading signal with proven pnl targets

**Preferred qualifications, capabilities and skills:**

* Experience with high-frequency trading or algorithmic trading.
* Knowledge of financial databases and data management tools.
* Experience with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP).
* Proficiency in financial software packages (e.g., MATLAB, R, Python libraries).

title: Executive Director, Global Social Media (Drunk Elephant)
description:
**Job Summary:**  

The Executive Director, Global Social Media is a seasoned social leader, deeply passionate about advancing the latest strategies, fostering community engagement, and driving brand storytelling initiatives. The Executive Director, Global Social Media is responsible for the strategic development of cohesive Social first strategies that align with brand and product marketing objectives. These strategies will generate brand awareness, engagement, loyalty and will foster our community of brand advocates. This role entails close alignment with the Founder's vision, bringing the brand’s philosophy to life.
  
  

This role will create and drive the roadmap to win on key platforms such as Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube, as well as lead innovative ideas for content that can be scaleable and unique to Drunk Elephant across key digital platforms (Paid Media, E-Commerce). Additionally, the Executive Director will drive all Lo-Fi content creation, fueling organic social/owned channels, paid media and retailer/PDP needs. The Executive Director will also champion Social globally, providing guidance to markets with their own social owned brand channels, liaising with key strategic partners on leveraging brand led social assets. They have strong expertise in measurement and are able to advance how we assess the value and impact of our Social channel activations.
  
  

**Primary Duties & Responsibilities:**  

Oversee and accelerate the brand’s Global Social footprint, inclusive of all owned platforms with a strong focus on priority channels Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube.
  
Reimagine and reset key brand channel content pillars, DNA and strategy.
  
Innovate new strategic thinking across the board and optimize performance across all social media activations.
  
Build differentiating social campaigns and programming designed to nurture community, support acquisition and drive engagement.
  
Grow, cultivate, and maintain an active and loyal social media community. Responding to comments, messages, and mentions in a timely and professional manner.
  
Support digital innovation initiatives with an owned strategy to drive awareness with Drunk Elephant audiences.
  
Oversee all Lo-Fi Content creation in close collaboration with Creative across multiple consumer facing channels – organic social, paid media and retailer/PDP in partnership with cross functional teams – Global Marketing, Creative, E-Commerce, etc.
  
Partner with priority markets, including the U.S., on content requests and compelling social co-op opportunities driving to key specialty retailers.
  
Oversee community management strategy and day-to-day execution, inclusive of response protocol and crisis response.
  
Review and approve monthly content calendars for key markets i.e. China.
  
Oversee and approve monthly and project-specific social media reporting – responsible for actioning key insights and driving evolution and change for DE to remain digital first amongst competition.
  
Lead and manage direct reports, providing guidance and support to achieve performance goals.
  
Collaborate with cross functional departments including Global Marketing, US Marketing and International Business to integrate social media strategies into broader marketing initiatives.
  
Keep up to date with industry trends and changes in algorithms and platforms. Implement innovative and emerging practices to stay ahead of the competition.
  
  

**Qualifications & Competencies:**  

Minimum 10 years experience in social media and digital marketing
  
Bachelor Degree Excellent written, verbal, presentation and organizational skills Passion for social media, community and skincare
  
A passionate, energetic team oriented individual with strong analytical, interpersonal, creative and leadership skills
  
A strong sense of urgency, ability to manage details and projects while responding to changing priorities
  
Ability to manage and train team members
  
Proficient in Excel, Power Point, Word
  
Familiarity with online analytical tools and social scheduling applications, such as: Dash Hudson and Tribe Dynamics

The D, BD oversees multiple projects and timelines with a detail-oriented approach. =======================

title: Software Quality Assurance Director-Remote
description:
**Millennium Systems International** is an exciting and dynamic software company based in Parsippany, NJ and was founded in 1987 to provide the beauty and wellness industry with forward-thinking, powerful management software and vital tools. We’ve built a company based on revolutionary technology, outstanding support, and more importantly, a strong passion to educate salon and spa owners on how to sustain success. Our software is utilized in thousands of salons and spas in over 36 countries, processes billions of dollars in transactions per year and is used by hundreds of thousands of users. Millennium Systems International is honored to have been named a New Jersey Top Workplace for 2022, 2023, and 2024! We have also just won Top Workplaces Culture Award.

We are seeking an experienced and highly motivated Software Quality Assurance (QA) Director to join our team. As the Software QA Director, you will be responsible for leading a team of QA engineers and ensuring the delivery of high-quality software products. You will play a critical role in defining and implementing software quality standards, processes, and methodologies to meet customer expectations and industry best practices.

**SPONSORSHIP NOT AVAILABLE. MSI IS UNABLE TO SPONSOR CANDIDATES.**

**Responsibilities:**

· Lead and manage a team of QA engineers, providing mentorship, guidance, and support.

· Define team goals, objectives, and performance metrics to drive continuous improvement.

· Foster a collaborative and positive work environment that encourages innovation and accountability.

· Develop and implement a comprehensive QA strategy and roadmap aligned with the organization's goals and objectives.

· Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define quality standards, processes, and methodologies.

· Identify and prioritize QA activities based on project requirements, risks, and constraints.

· Establish effective test plans, test cases, and test data management strategies.

· Test Execution and Automation:

· Oversee and participate in the execution of test plans, test cases, and test scripts to ensure software meets quality standards and functional requirements.

· Drive the implementation and maintenance of test automation frameworks and tools to improve efficiency and effectiveness of testing processes.

· Monitor and analyze test results, identify defects, and work closely with development teams to resolve issues in a timely manner.

· Ensure comprehensive test coverage across different platforms, devices, and environments

· Define and track quality metrics to assess the effectiveness of the QA process and identify areas for improvement

· Generate accurate and timely reports on testing progress, test coverage, and defect metric

· Present QA findings, recommendations, and status updates to stakeholders and senior management.

· Continuously evaluate and enhance QA processes, tools, and techniques to optimize efficiency and effectiveness.

· Stay up to date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in software quality assurance.

· Drive a culture of quality and continuous improvement throughout the organization.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field. **A master's degree is a plus.**
* Proven experience (10 years) as a Software QA Director or similar role in a software development environment.
* Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools, and processes.
* SQL, Postman, Selenium**,** Azure DevOps
* Methodologies such as Black-box testing and white-box testing approaches.
* Equivalence partitioning and boundary value analysis
* Error guessing and exploratory testing
* Usability testing and user acceptance testing
* Proficient in test planning, test design, and test execution.
* Experience with test automation frameworks and tools (Selenium for C#).
* Familiarity with Agile and DevOps methodologies.
* Excellent leadership and people management skills.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.

Join our dynamic team and take on a leadership role in ensuring the delivery of high-quality software products that exceed customer expectations. Apply now and contribute to our organization's success!

**SPONSORSHIP NOT AVAILABLE. MSI IS UNABLE TO SPONSOR CANDIDATES.**

**Benefits**

· Comprehensive subsidized benefits package including medical, dental and vision

· Culture geared toward collaboration and growth

· Subsidized Medical, Dental and Vision

· 401k with matching contribution

· Life insurance

· Long-Term Disability

· Generous PTO, vacation, and paid holidays

Job Type: Full-time

Experience:

* SQL: 8 years (Required)
* Selenium: 8 years (Required)
* Test automation: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Assistant Manager
description:
We are seeking an Assistant Store Manager. You must have a passion for high street retail, a strong customer service background and together with the Store Manager the ability to drive change, continue to grow and develop the sales team and boost sales.

The role is to assist the Store Manager and ensure that Brompton Junction London continues to offer an excellent customer experience and as the flagship store staff represent the brand to the best of their ability. The store must continue to grow and innovate through bike sales, workshop services and events at the store.

You should be a strong team player, a lover of customer service, with an intense desire to have a successful career in the retail industry. If you are looking for a company that offers support, recognition and progression coupled with a fun working environment, then this is the role for you!

**Main duties:**

* Along with the Store Manager, day to day management of all aspects of the store ensuring that it is trading effectively is adequately staffed and that customers’ needs are being met.
* Along with the Store Manager, day to day management of employees, including recruitment, attendance, motivation, welfare, training and development.
* Management of any complaints and enquiries as they arise.
* Plan, forecast and report on sales, costs and overall business performance accurately and in a timely fashion.
* Follow the pricing policy set by Brompton Bicycle Ltd, implementing price changes when notified.
* Liaise with Brompton Bicycle Ltd to plan, implement and advertise promotional activities, including in-store bike maintenance courses, bike assembly demonstrations and all special events.
* Ensure that the store environment, especially the in-store displays and merchandising meet the company’s high standards and brand guidelines.
* Plan and implement shop merchandising, layout and customer traffic flow to maximise customers satisfaction and brand engagement, uphold the appearance of the store and the brands image, while observing health and safety requirements and facilitating sales.
* Manage selling and customer service activities and practises by continually developing all the staff members’ competence in customer care, to optimise customer satisfaction and sustain sales performance.
* Ensure that in-store cash and payment systems are managed in accordance with the company’s procedures and policies at all times.
* Manage costs and overheads, and all factors affecting the profitable performance of the shop.
* Ensure that in-store stock levels are maintained at all times by implementing regular, accurate stock checks and ordering systems to agreed levels.
* Supervise customer data in accordance with Data Protection legislation, and ensure that all information obtained in-store is also added to the database maintained at head office.
* Ensure that the store EPOS and other IT systems are used correctly, and that all store personnel receive adequate training to enable systems to run in the Store Managers absence.
* Ensure that all company and local security practises are followed and that an up to date key holders list is copied to head office.
* Seek and develop knowledge about competitor activity in the local area, especially on pricing and tactics, communicating this to relevant departments in Brompton, and identifying opportunities to promote the store.
* Attend meetings and contribute to company strategy and policy-making as required.
* Develop personal skills and capability through on-going training, as provided by the company and elsewhere, subject to company approval.
* Ensure that you take care of your and others health and safety at all times, complying with health and safety obligations, in particular by reporting promptly defects, risks or hazards.
* Ensure that all employees are thoroughly trained in the health and safety procedures of the store, including risk assessments.
* Carry out any additional duties that may, from time to time, be required.

**Person Specification:**

* Experience in a retail or customer-focused environment, with at least 1 year’s assistant management responsibility, is essential.
* Demonstrable experience of raising standards of customer service while driving retail sales is desirable, as is experience of working for a quality brand in a retail environment.

A commitment to, and aptitude for, excellent customer service and maintaining high standards are essential. Competence in Microsoft Word, Outlook and Excel programs to at least intermediate level is likewise required, as are selling and up –selling skills and an interest in cycling.

Prior knowledge of Brompton products, either as a consumer or through working in the trade, and cycling as a regular means of transport/exercise will be viewed favourably.

**Personal Attributes:**

**Communication:** Communicates effectively, listens sensitively to others, adapts his/her communication to audience and fosters effective communication with other.

**Delegation:** Able to make full and best use of line reports; provides support and encouragement to ensure his/her team collectively achieves.

**Leadership**: Acts as a role model to the team, anticipates and plans for change and communicates clear objectives/vision to the team; able to both provide and receive feedback/criticism in a positive manner.

**Flexibility:** Modifies his/her approach to achieve an end goal or task. Is open to change and has a positive approach to work and colleagues. Demonstrates initiative, and continually looks to improve the quality, quantity, and effectiveness of his/her work. Able to multi-task.

**Resilience & Tenacity**: Remains cooperative, calm, even-tempered and polite at all times.

**Influencing:** Is sensitive to the needs of others and is able to convey his/her point of view and gain agreement or acceptance from others.

**Targets Orientation:** Enthusiastic and driven to exceed the expectations of others for the delivery of quality service to consumer and the stores financial performance. Takes pride in the achievements of the team, store, the service he/she provides consumers, and able to manage his/her time to maximise productivity.

**Team Work:** Contributes fully to the team effort, ensuring that help is offered to other with a “can-do” attitude when another team member is over-burdened. Has a “hands-on”, practical and resourceful approach.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $27.00 - $30.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount

Experience:

* Supervising experience: 1 year (preferred)
* Restaurant management: 1 year (preferred)
* Bar management: 1 year (preferred)
* Hospitality: 1 year (preferred)
* Customer service: 1 year (preferred)
* Management: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

* Driving Licence (preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Venue Representative - Jersey City
description:
***This is a US based position and the successful applicant will be hired into one of Poseidon's US-based partner companies.***

  

***All offers of employment with WORLDS™ are contingent upon clear results of a thorough background check.***

  

We're looking for energetic people to join our team hosting the immersive show MESMERICA (https://tickets.mesmerica.com). You will be working as an on-site rep and our company ambassador to the venue staff team and audience. This is a part-time employment position. MESMERICA will run at the planetarium as long as there is a demand for seats. Our ideal candidate would be tech savvy, have customer service experience, social media knowledge and an upbeat, positive personality.


**WORLDS™ shows are fully immersive music and art cinematic projection shows for planetariums and giant screen theaters designed to relieve stress, evoke joy, happiness, and relaxation.**


**Responsibilities include:**


Setting up/taking down our lobby setup to include: signage, check-in table, and merchandise  

Welcoming and checking in our audiences, answering guest's questions  

Merchandise inventory and sales  

Overall event facilitation, ensuring a smooth guest experience  

Offering suggestions or comments on how we can do better  

Communication: this role requires timely communication with our Venue Operations team


\\***Great communication skills are a MUST for this position.\\***  

  

**Requirements:**  

Comfortable with using iPad apps, including WhatsApp  

Upbeat, positive personality  

Customer service experience  

Communicative  

Detail oriented  

Reliable  

Punctual  

Good judgment (able to timely relay any concerns or issues)  

Leadership / teamwork qualities (able to confidently direct provided on-site staff helpers when necessary)  

Natural problem solver  

Calm under pressure in high stress environments

  

**More about our values**


We expect:  

* Hard work, including some off hours (since we are running shows round the world);
* World-class standards.
* Attention to detail; we are moving fast and don't have time to be checking others' work.
* Humor (lots of humor).
* Respect and consideration for other team-members and our audience.
* Ethics - while we push the boundaries of the tech, we always act with honesty and integrity.
* Long-term, big picture thinking.
* A collaborative outlook and attitude.
* Ownership of mistakes, and the ability to turn them in to learning opportunities. We don't do guilt.
* Open, honest communication.

**Physical Demands and Work Environment**


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these functions.


While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands or fingers, handle or feel objects, tools, or controls. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, distance vision, and the ability to adjust focus. The noise level in the work environment is usually low to moderate.

title: Unit Computing Specialist
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Unit Computing Specialist
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Information Technology
  

**Department** RBS - Computing Services
  

**Overview**
The Office of Technology & Instructional Services (OTIS) Department at Rutgers Business School is at the forefront of integrating innovative digital solutions with academic excellence. As a key enabler of the school’s mission to educate business leaders of tomorrow, our IT department is dedicated to fostering an environment that supports groundbreaking teaching, research, and community engagement through state-of-the-art technology and services.
We are committed to providing a robust infrastructure, advanced technological tools, and a wide range of support services designed to enhance the learning experience of our students and empower our faculty and staff. Our team is composed of dedicated professionals who work collaboratively across various units to support the technological needs of our community.
From managing classroom technology, providing endpoint support, and administering business-critical applications to maintaining the school’s firewall and network infrastructure, our IT department plays a critical role in maintaining a cutting-edge academic environment. At Rutgers Business School, we believe in leveraging technology to solve real-world problems. Our IT department is involved in numerous projects aimed at driving innovation in business education, administration, and research. We are looking for dynamic individuals who are passionate about making a difference through technology.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers University- Newark (RU-N), an urban public research university and anchor institution, located in Newark, New Jersey, a city of promise is seeking a Unit Computing Specialist. Reports to the Associate Director of IT Services for the Business School and is expected to work both in the Livingston and Newark Campuses.  

  

This position is responsible for and not limited to the following:  

* Providing technical support, assistance, and consultation to students, faculty, staff.
* Ensures that system hardware, operating systems, software systems, and related procedures adhere to departmental and university policies.
* Responsible for on-demand classroom/lab/special event technology support installed in classrooms, computer labs, and public events.
* Provides varied tasks relating to the direct support of end users of instructional technology systems and services for both classroom and public event purposes.
* Performs analytical, technical and administrative work to plan, design, and manage technology in public computer labs, computer classrooms and offices.

title: Head of Pricing and Planning, Sports Team
description:
* 10+ years of building and leading large teams and working in matrixed operating structures experience
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent
* Experience working and communicating with multiple stakeholders, C-level executives and cross functional teams or equivalent
* Experience in strategic thinking about business, enterprise software products, and new technology platforms and architectures or equivalent


Amazon Advertising offers advertisers a rich array of media solutions now inclusive of the NFL on Prime Video. Our team is looking for a leader who understands the sports landscape and how to financially manage and plan in line with the marketplace and company goals. This individual will be responsible for building the media plan and mix strategy for sports sales through both Upfront and Scatter marketplaces to deliver on goals working together with other yield management teams. They will lead all system management and hiring for the new team to help support this business function.
  
  

Key job responsibilities
  
This individual will be responsible for building the media plan and mix strategy for sports sales through both Upfront and Scatter marketplaces to hit our goals. They will be an important part of decision making for the business as they will manage our responsibilities from a bigger picture with sales executives asks by client to ensure delivery of quota and delivery of all ad sales deal points. This role will collaborate with Finance, Ad product, Ad ops and Sales to control inventory flow, ad formats, assignment and pricing in line with the company’s financial goals. Additionally, this lead will gain weekly alignment on estimates with research and insights teams to manage company liability. Responsible for building a data base and RC that will lead to insights on how to evolve the business and GTM strategy through the term. Leader to designate market rates for sponsorships and managing sell-thru levels with the needs of the business. Manage and decision on internal or external systems to help generate contracts, proposals, and posts to all customers, including Halo plans across DSP and STV buys. Cross collaborate with yield management teams on all ads offerings that will be included in TNF proposals.
  
  

About the team
  
Amazon Advertising is standing up a sports sales team in the US who will be overseeing our biggest step into sports to date which is our exclusive broadcast rights for TNF starting in 2022 through an 11 year term. It is an exciting time to be part of Amazon Ads as we look to establish a new way to transact around sports and streaming and how we partner with our customers.
  
  

* 5+ years of managing and developing high performance teams experience


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.
  
  

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $174,300/year in our lowest geographic market up to $288,200/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

title: Program Coordinator I
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Program Coordinator I
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Administrative & Support
  

**Department** SASN -Earth & Environmental Sci
  

**Overview**
Understanding the Earth processes is of utmost importance in the modern world. We offer curricula in environmental sciences, environmental earth sciences, earth engineering and environmental sustainability and prepare our students for successful and rewarding careers or graduate studies.

Our faculty has strengths in water, soil and air pollution and innovative techniques to study them. Research and education emphasize practical applications, especially in the field. The department offers rigorous courses that are comparable to the best in the country. Student research is an integral part of the learning experience and provides opportunities for enhanced understanding. Technical abilities and effective communication are emphasized in preparation for successful careers and graduate studies. Small classes provide individual attention to students for enhanced learning. Our students are considered by both industry leaders and graduate programs to be well prepared for their chosen paths.

From the oceans to the atmosphere, Earth’s surface and beyond, our faculty and students research all areas of Earth and Environmental Sciences. See our individual research areas for further information: https://sasn.rutgers.edu/academics-admissions/academic-departments/earth-environmental-science  


  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers University-Newark (RU-N), an urban public research university and anchor institution, located in Newark, New Jersey, a city of promise is seeking a Program Coordinator I for the Geophysics for Environmental Management Students (GEMS) project in the Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences, School of Arts and Sciences-Newark (SASN). Reporting to the Principal Investigator, this Program Coordinator I is responsible for the administration and coordination of the GEMS project.  

  

This position is responsible for and not limited to the following:  

* Coordinating day-to-day operations for the project.
* Coordinating all aspects of the project including GEMS programming, curriculum development, events and meetings, and coordination of and with participants, and related programs and academic and government partners.
* Providing operational support to project leadership, participating in project decisions, program development and implementation, and evaluation.
* Maintaining and supporting the use of department geophysical instrumentation.
* Conducting research in near surface geophysics in collaboration with GEMS participants, under the direction of the PI and co-PI.
* Planning and organizing annual project meetings and other events.
* Collecting, maintaining, and providing program information/drafts for funder reports.
* Establishing and maintaining effective relationships within Rutgers and with academic partners and collaborating laboratories.

**Certifications/Licenses**

* Must be able to work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven, stakeholder focused environment.

title: Admissions Officer
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Admissions Officer
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Admissions
  

**Department** Sch of Law-Nwk, Dean's Office
  

**Overview**
Rutgers Law School operates across two campus locations, in Newark and Camden. The Law School is seeking to hire an Admission Officer for its Newark location. Located in New Jersey’s largest and most diverse city, Rutgers Newark is immersed in a thriving arts and cultural scene, from the Ironbound neighborhood to University Heights, and is a short walk from the Prudential Center and New Jersey Performing Arts Center. Located near major public transportation centers, such as the NJ Light Rail, PATH and Amtrak, a short train ride will get you into NYC and the surrounding area. The Law Admissions and Financial Aid Offices are seeking to add a member who is student-centric, collaborative and communicative.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers University-Newark (RU-N), an urban public research university and anchor institution, located in Newark, New Jersey, a city of promise is seeking an Admissions Officer. This position reports to the Assistant Dean of Admissions for Rutgers Law School at the Newark Campus. The Admissions Officer assists with all aspects of the admissions and financial aid processes. In addition to reviewing applications, this position also requires representing the law school at recruitment fairs, forums, and panels; counseling students regarding the admissions process; and assisting our Senior Financial Aid Administrator with the counseling and communications with our prospective and current student populations.  

  

This position is responsible for and not limited to the following:  

* Assisting in the planning and implementation of Orientation, open houses, webinars, information sessions, and other recruitment activities
* Assisting with the review and awarding of institutional and endowed scholarships; and performing other duties and special projects as assigned by the Assistant Dean of Admissions.
* This position requires occasional evening and weekend event responsibilities and seasonal recruiting travel.
* Serves as a liaison between prospective students and other external constituents on issues related to diversity and inclusion in legal education and the profession as a whole.
* Under the direction of the Assistant Dean of Admissions, the Assistant Director will engage with current students and Law School administrators to help develop and implement policies, pipeline and outreach programs, and curricular requirements that foster an environment of diversity and inclusion at Rutgers Law School.
* Must be able to work with minimal supervision and complete projects in a timely fashion. Knows the mission, goals, and objectives of the University and Rutgers Law School in order to communicate accurate and relevant information to prospects, applicants and admitted students.
* This position will involve evening and weekend work and travel.

title: Student Counselor
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Student Counselor
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Advising and Counseling
  

**Department** SASN -Office of Academic Svcs
  

**Overview**
School of Arts & Sciences-Newark is the second largest unit in the Rutgers system, with two colleges NCAS and UC-N, over 19 academic departments and programs, over 31 programs of study, over 4,000 undergraduate students, and over 1,000 faculty and staff. We serve all undergraduates at Rutgers University-Newark (RU-N); and offer a broad selection of more than 2,000 undergraduate and graduate courses a year in more than 40 subjects.  


  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers University- Newark (RU-N), an urban public research university and anchor institution, located in Newark, New Jersey, a city of promise is seeking a Student Counselor. Reporting to the Assistant Dean in the Office of Academic Services (OAS) in the School of Arts and Sciences-Newark (SASN), the Academic Advisor is a team member in a fast-paced, deadline-driven, customer service-focused environment.  

  

This position is responsible for and not limited to the following:  

* Provides academic advising and counseling to undergraduate students, assists them with problem solving, and teaches them to advocate for themselves;
* Establishes and maintains productive contact with assigned caseload of Newark College of Arts & Sciences (NCAS) and University College-Newark (UC-N) students to counsel them and facilitate their declaration of major, progress toward graduation, and successful career and/or professional development;
* Works with the OAS junior, senior, and transfer services team on the coordination, development, and facilitation of initiatives targeting students, including, and not limited to, workshops, transcript evaluations, new student registration and outreach, advanced placement credit assessment, and recruiting events;
* Coordinates the graduation certification process and liaises with academic departments and other student service offices to ensure all certifications are completed accurately and within the deadline provided;
* Works with all relevant personnel and offices to update and improve databases, software, programs, and workflow used in the certification process;
* Creates and facilitates initiatives for students in their junior and senior years, maintaining contact and communicating information in effective, efficient, and innovative manners;
* Serves as an Academic Integrity (AI) facilitator, communicates, supports, and upholds AI policies and procedures;
* Assists with office events, including, and not limited to, commencement activities, major/minor fair, as well as other events and duties as needed;
* Works in a manner that furthers the mission of OAS, SASN, and RU-N and contributes to strategic goals.

  


  

**Position Status** Full Time
  

**Hours Per Week**
  

**Daily Work Shift**
  

**Work Arrangement**
Consistent with the current application of Rutgers Policy 60.3.22 or the applicable provisions of relevant collective negotiations agreements, this position may be eligible for a hybrid work arrangement. **Seniority Unit**

**Position Pension Eligibility** ABP
  

Qualifications
**Minimum Education and Experience**
* Requires a bachelor’s degree in student counseling, college student personnel, psychology, social work, education, higher education administration, or a related field and two years relevant experience in academic counseling/advisement; or the equivalent combination of education and/or experience that demonstrates knowledge and understanding of transfer student populations and programs, student development and counseling theories and applications, and workshop design and presentation.
  


  

**Certifications/Licenses**
  

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**
* Requires excellent written and oral communication skills; strong organizational skills; and the ability to handle and prioritize multiple tasks;
* Requires the ability to interact successfully and confidentially with a wide range of individuals at all levels of the University community; and strong computer literacy, including use of databases;
* Requires excellent problem-solving skills, as well as the ability to multitask and function autonomously with limited supervision;
* Must be able to work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven, customer-service focused environment.


  

**Preferred Qualifications**
* Master’s degree and experience in a university or other educational setting with experience in program development and conducting workshops for diverse populations strongly preferred;
* Knowledge of academic integrity facilitation and degree audits also desired.
  


  

**Equipment Utilized**
* Must be proficient in the Microsoft Office Suite;
* Will use the Student Records Database (SRDB), degree audits, Maxient, in-house applications, and any database or program utilized by the University to perform the duties of this position now or in the future;
* Must be familiar with or learn the office equipment, software, and specialized programs and/or materials needed to support the effective and efficient performance of this position.


  

**Physical Demands and Work Environment**
* OAS is a fast-paced, deadline-driven, customer service-focused environment;
* Responsibilities will include attendance at and participation in evening and weekend activities, as needed.

title: Program Coordinator I (Multiple Vacancies)
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Program Coordinator I (Multiple Vacancies)
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Financial Aid
  

**Department** Financial Aid - Nwk
  

**Overview**
The Office of Financial Aid provides access, financial aid resources, and advisory services for the Rutgers University- Newark (RU-N) community, facilitating student recruitment, enrollment, and retention. The Office of Financial Aid (OFA) is integral to Rutgers University-Newark (RU-N). It’s a key partner in carrying out and actualizing the overall purpose and strategic plans of access and affordability. We are committed to removing financial barriers to student enrollment and retention. To accomplish this, the Office of Financial Aid strives to balance responsible stewardship of all federal, state, private, and internal aid resources. Core services are built around a student-centered culture, working with our students and their families to seek, obtain, and make informed financial aid decisions through literacy and outreach.  


  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers University- Newark (RU-N), an urban public research university and anchor institution, located in Newark, New Jersey, a city of promise is seeking a Program Coordinator I. Under the direction of the Assistant Manager, this position will have an integral and lead role in the Office of Financial Aid’s processing team, which comprises the Assistant Managers, Senior Financial Aid Counselors, and Administrative Assistants.  

  

This position is responsible for and not limited to the following:* Perform more technically demanding financial aid duties, including but not limited to reviewing and validating the completeness of submitted federal verification and professional judgment (PJ) documents
* Oversee advisement and outreach to ensure that verification and PJs can be completed promptly to avoid a student’s loss of critical financial aid resources. Through the utilization of the incomplete verification and PJ reports, students will be identified to the AC. The AC will use these reports to engage with students via emails, salesforce cases, and in-person meetings to ensure timely submissions and conflicts of information to support maximum aid eligibility.
* Hold quarterly presentations and workshops at various on-campus site events to assist students with documentation submissions via the student portal.
* Work with UES’ verification team to understand the required follow-up and then advise the student accordingly.
* Counsel students and their families on application procedures, availability, and eligibility for student aid resources.
* Assists students by reconciling problems that concern them or are handled by other university departments and external agencies.
* Serves as the primary point of contact for initial inquiries from Salesforce, MyRUN, and the Office of Financial Aid’s front counter.
* Under the leadership of the Assistant Managers, the incumbent will coordinate and be accountable for determining a student’s eligibility using established State and institutional guidelines.
* Coordinate the inflow and outflow of financial aid information and facilitate information to the appropriate OSS department via email, call centers, and R4Success.
* Advise prospective and current students/departments on financial aid.
* Concerning the functions described here, all Office of Financial Aid team members must participate in outreach literacy and advisement to students, parents, and the community.

  

**Position Status** Full Time
  

**Hours Per Week**
  

**Daily Work Shift** Day
  

**Work Arrangement**
Consistent with the current application of Rutgers Policy 60.3.22 or the applicable provisions of relevant collective negotiations agreements, this position may be eligible for a hybrid work arrangement. Flexible work arrangements are not permanent, are subject to change or discontinuation, and contingent on the employee receiving approval in the FlexWork@RU Application System.

**Grade** 04
  

**Position Salary**
  

**Annual Minimum Salary** 57356.000
  

**Annual Mid Range Salary** 71372.000
  

**Annual Maximum Salary** 85388.000
  

**Standard Hours** 37.50
  

**Union Description** URA-AFT Administrative
  

**Payroll Designation** PeopleSoft
  

**Benefits**
Rutgers offers a comprehensive benefit program to eligible employees. For details, please go to **http://uhr.rutgers.edu/benefits/benefits-overview**.  

  

**Seniority Unit**
  

**Terms of Appointment** Staff - 12 month
  

**Position Pension Eligibility** ABP
  

Qualifications
**Minimum Education and Experience**
* Bachelor’s degree
* At least two years’ work experience in student financial aid directly related to award and aid determination, need analysis, verification, and packaging.
  


  

**Certifications/Licenses**
  

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**
* Experience in higher education or university setting.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.


  

**Preferred Qualifications**
* Analytical Skills: Synthesize complex or diverse information; collect and research data; use intuition and experience to complement data; design workflows and procedures;
* Customer Service Skills: Manage difficult or emotional customer situations; respond promptly to customer needs; solicit customer feedback to improve service; respond to requests for service and assistance in a friendly and timely manner; demonstrate sensitivity to the diverse needs of students and customers from various socio-economic and cultural backgrounds; speak clearly, listen and get clarification; present financial aid information and respond accurately to questions in individual and group settings;
* Computer Skills: High level of proficiency and accuracy in Windows file management, Microsoft Office programs, and department-specific software programs;
* Oral Communication: Ability to speak clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; listen and get clarification; respond well to questions; demonstrate group presentation skills; participate in meetings.
* Quality: Demonstrate accuracy and thoroughness; look for ways to improve and promote quality; apply feedback to improve performance; monitor own work to ensure quality;
* Professionalism: Ability to approach others tactfully; react well under pressure; treat others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position; accept responsibility for own actions; follow through on commitments.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Administrative Assistant
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Administrative & Support
  

**Department** SASN -Math & Computer Science
  

**Overview**
Department of Mathematics and Computer Science at Rutgers University-Newark offers undergraduate degrees in Mathematics, Applied Mathematics, and Computer Science in the Newark College of Arts and Sciences and in the University College, and a minor in Data Science, Computer Science, or Math. The Department also offers a Ph.D. in Mathematical Sciences. This is a joint Ph.D. program with the New Jersey Institute of Technology. Here, combined graduate faculties from both institutions provide research opportunities in a variety of fields including Algebra, Analysis, Data Science, Geometric Group Theory, Kleinian Groups, Low-dimensional Topology, Mathematical Physics, Number Theory, Representation Theory and Teichmüller Theory. For more information, please visit: https://sasn.rutgers.edu/mathematics-and-computer-science.  


  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers University- Newark (RU-N), an urban public research university and anchor institution, located in Newark, New Jersey, a city of promise is seeking an Administrative Assistant for the Department of Mathematics and Computer Science in the School of Arts and Sciences-Newark. Reporting to Department Administrator. The Administrative Assistant provides administrative support to the Department and all of its programs, including to the Department’s faculty, staff, and students. This individual is a first point of contact for the Department, ensuring effective and efficient operations through a wide range of administrative responsibilities.  

  

This position is responsible for and not limited to the following:  

* Assists Department Chair, undergraduate coordinator, graduate coordinator, department staff, and others with coordination and administration of academic programs and student support
* Manages general inquiries; maintains databases, websites, and social media; arranges and coordinates events and meetings
* Prepares and processes payroll appointments and transactions
* Prepares project cost adjustments and business expense reimbursements; among other duties.
* Manages day-to-day administrative operations of Department’s front office.

title: Administrative Coordinator
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Administrative Coordinator
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Administrative & Support
  

**Department** SASN - Dean's Office
  

**Overview**
The School of Arts and Sciences-Newark (SASN) is a place where exploration, discovery, and imagination come together to form the core of a liberal arts education. We serve all undergraduates at Rutgers University-Newark (RU-N); and offer a broad selection of more than 2,000 undergraduate and graduate courses a year in more than 40 subjects. SASN combines the best of a large research university with a small liberal arts college. RU-N is a remarkably diverse, urban, public research university that is not just in Newark but of Newark-an anchor of our home city.  


  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers University- Newark (RU-N), an urban public research university and anchor institution, located in Newark, New Jersey, a city of promise is seeking an Administrative Coordinator to assist with personnel matters. The Administrative Coordinator is a member of the Dean’s Office team embracing the challenges of achieving community goals and supporting team efforts to grow together.  

  

This position is responsible for and not limited to the following:  

* Provides support for personnel and payroll, and other administrative and operational activities for the Dean’s Office, School of Arts and Sciences-Newark (SASN)
* Supports staff recruitment and personnel activities, including, but not limited to, recruitment, onboarding, training and development, record keeping
* Participates in, contributes to, and supports special projects, training, learning and development, and other initiatives to cultivate a positive work environment and to promote, support, strengthen, and expand the relationship between the Dean’s Office and academic departments and programs as well as other administrative partners
* Contributes to the design, implementation, and maintenance of new systems
* Ensures a professional, responsive, and welcoming environment for diverse stakeholders, including faculty, staff, students, administrators, and others
* Ensures clear, consistent, reliable, and thorough communications
* Uses technology to achieve operational efficiencies and a streamlined workflow. Identifies opportunities for process and other improvements and provides feedback for ongoing improvements, identifying trends and knowledge-based needs and providing insight to increase operational efficiencies
* Must be able to multitask in a fast-paced, stakeholder-focused, highly confidential environment with an understanding of the mission, vision, role, and goals of the Dean’s Office, SASN, and RU-N, and the role the tasks and responsibilities of this position play in the achievement of these goals

title: Director of Construction Operations
description:
**POSITION SUMMARY:**  
This position is responsible for coordinating and overseeing all aspects in the implementation of the company’s construction department. This position provides leadership in developing strategies and tactics for continuous performance improvement of his/her associates, department, and the company in general. The director ensures increasing level of customer and associate satisfaction while improving the efficiency of manpower, materials, Sales, and overall company advancement.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**  
The essential functions of this position include, but are not limited to, the following:

* Follow company policies, procedures, and work standards.
* Manage the coordination of jobs, materials, subcontractors with the construction department.
* Review the daily/weekly construction schedule.
* Analyze all upcoming jobs, plans, sketches, and contracts with the Sales/Estimating Teams.
* Schedule construction crews in coordination with the deadlines set by project managers.
* Perform site inspections with project management.
* Oversee the scheduling of equipment, machinery, and outside subs, when needed.
* Monitor progress on all construction jobs.
* Ensure installation quality standards.
* Hire, organize, and train project management staff.
* Develop construction department to perform at maximum efficiency and profitability.
* Able to read and interpret blueprints and job specifications.
* Ability to deliver quality results under tight deadlines
* Demonstrate accountability for work being performed and completed on schedule.
* This position will require working Saturdays during peak season.

**NON-ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**  
1. Participate and Contribute to Company initiatives.  
2. Leads in the orientation/training of new team members.  
3. Develops new ideas that will help the company run more efficiently.  
4. Demonstrate strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with external clients and associates on a consistent basis  
5. Other duties assigned

**SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY:**

This position is responsible for assigning, reviewing and checking work of other employees.

List of positions/job titles reporting to this position:

* 1. Foremen – Construction
* 2. Purchasing Manager
* 3. Field Resource Manager
* 4. Yard Manager
* 5. Dispatch & Material Manager

**EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:**

Bachelor’s Degree

Field of Study (if applicable): B.A./B.S. preferred or industry related experience.

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILL REQUIREMENTS:**

* Minimum 8 years of experience/knowledge in Commercial and Residential construction.
* Basic understanding of all types of construction machinery used in the landscape field.
* Five plus years’ experience in a leadership role within the landscape industry or profession.
* Able to read and interpret blueprints and job specifications.
* Demonstrate ability to effectively present information to top management, associates, public groups, and/or prospective clients.
* Demonstrate expert knowledge of company policies and procedures.
* Ability to develop budges and understand and interpret financials
* Demonstrate strong attention to detail.
* Demonstrate flexibility to perform duties wherever volume seems it necessary
* Ability to deliver quality results under tight deadlines.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office
* Proven working experience in construction management
* Demonstrate accountability for work being performed and completed on schedule.
* OSHA Certifications a plus

Benefits:

* 401k
* Company Paid Health Insurance
* Paid time off
* Dental insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday – Friday 7-5
* Saturdays 7-3:30 in Peak Season (March-July & Oct-Dec)

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $1.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Ability to Relocate:

* Tinton Falls, NJ 07753: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Work Location: In person
